captions.text:
Vsauce, what do Grand Turismo 2 and Fifa 2001
have in common? They were both released with

scratch-and-sniff discs...Fifa 2001 smelled
like turf, and Grand Turismo 2 smelled like
burnt rubber and fuel. Yeah...
This is Video Games WTF's.

Let's start with what happens in Fable II
when your dog gets stuck in a tree. Well,

as you can see, it's not really a problem-
you're just the proud new owner of the world's
first Tree Dog. Or is it Dog Tree?

One thing's for sure, it doesn't take a genius
to know that rocket launcher + cop car= (loud

boom) "Ahh I'll catch up with you guys later!
I'm just gonna go over here and bounce off
things..."

This actually isn't a glitch- it was made
with a script MOD called Simple Native Trainer.

But here's a glitch from Sleeping Dog's in
which a bike looks like it's driving itself,

but, actually, the driver is right here, smushed
in a ball with his broken arms still, somehow,
controlling the bike.
And, now, Glitch Humping.
Sports.

John Madden Football '92 has a feature where
an ambulance drives onto the field to aid

an injured player, and, subsequently, runs
over any players in its way.

"I got it, I got it! I freakin' ran through
the wall!"

This is a glitch in MLB 2K10 where two batters
appear to be up at bat at the same time. And,

after the first, pitch David Ortiz, a left-handed
batter, inexplicably teleports and becomes
right-handed.

There are some crazy glitches in WWE '12,
including running through a steel cage, and
simply floating away.
"Help, I can't get down! Oh Jesus!"

But check out this one of the Big Show getting
stuck in a ladder.
"Oh my god, Big Show!" (laughing)
WTF Games.

Tongue of the Fatman was a fighting game released
for the PC in 1989. It involves making your

way through a fighting tournament with strange
aliens to ultimately face The Fatman, who

awaits you holding a lollipop and an eyeball...And,
once you eventually fight him, he'll unleash

the Tongue of the Fatman, which comes out
of his stomach.

Snacks N' Jaxson was an arcade game released
by Bally featuring Jaxson de Box- a clown

who sneezes his nose off and tries to eat
all of the floating food infront of him before

his detached nose can break any windows. Oh,
and if you don't eat all the food, a tiny,

green chef-creature hits you in the face with
a pie.

And then there's Fireplacing for the Wii.
Released in 2010, this downloadable WiiWare

title claims to offer the most realistic fireplace
simulation. Choose the mood, light the fire,

and stoke the flame. Then, needing a slice
of that sweet fireplace simulation market,

Cozy Fire was released in 2011, boasting realistic
log physics, and 6 types of fires. To be fair,

these aren't really games- they're just Nintendo
Wii Fireplace Simulators...

Don't get stuck in the sky. Subscribe to Vsauce
3 for more video game WTF's. And, as always,
"Help me!! Help now!!" Thanks for watching.

title: Glitch Humping And More Video Game WTFs
